intro: Alchemilla faeroensis f. denudata, commonly known as the naked alchemilla, is a rare and distinctive plant native to the Faroe Islands. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its reduced foliage and delicate, often silver-tinged leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early summer, typically arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in coastal or rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
